definition: place of origin/source (of a war or a social movement)

policy/plan/scheme/bamboo slip for writing (old)/to whip (a horse)/to encourage/riding crop with sharp spines (old)/essay written for the imperial examinations (old)/upward horizontal stroke in calligraphy
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: The palace was a nest of intrigue.
sentences.chinese: 這座宮殿曾是陰謀詭計的策源地。

sentences.english: Iraq is becoming the new original place of religious extremism and campaign.
sentences.chinese: 伊拉克正成爲宗教極端思潮和運動的新策源地。

sentences.english: Greece was the cradle of Western civilization.
sentences.chinese: 希臘是西方文明的策源地。

sentences.english: Shangzhai site in Pinggu basin is an original place of Chinese environmental archaeology.
sentences.chinese: 上宅遺址所在的平谷盆地是中國環境考古策源地。

sentences.english: Active fault is the source of earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 活斷層是地震的潛在策源地。

sentences.english: It's where the majority of Earth's major quakes occur as major plate boundaries collide.
sentences.chinese: 同時也是地球主要的地震策源地和板塊邊界的碰撞地。

sentences.english: There is the source of the recurring pestilence .
sentences.chinese: 那裏是一再發生瘟疫的策源地。

definition: the birthplace (of sth good)/the cradle (e.g. of art)
(military) strategic town/(fig.) major center (for commerce, culture or tourism etc)
front-line/forward position/outpost/extending ahead/frontier (of science, technology etc)

the not-very-distant past/modern times, excluding recent decades/(in the context of Chinese history) the period from the Opium Wars until the May 4th Movement (mid-19th century to 1919)/capitalist times (pre-1949)
and even/to go so far as to
